meanings.definition: To grant or convey (property) by feoffment.
meanings.sent1: He was feoffing his land to his son.
meanings.sent2: The king feoffed the estate to the loyal knight.
meanings.sent3: The farmer was feoffing his chickens to the fox, unknowingly.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was feoffing her dreams away with each compromise.
meanings.sent5: The act of feoffing was a serious commitment in medieval times.

meanings.definition: The act of granting or conveying property by feoffment.
meanings.sent1: Feoffing was a common practice in the feudal system.
meanings.sent2: The feoffing of the manor was a grand ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game pretending to be feoffing kings and queens.
meanings.sent4: The feoffing of the estate symbolized a bond of trust.
meanings.sent5: The history book explained the significance of feoffing in land ownership.
